definition: to enter a school or college/to go to school for the first time as a child
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
percentage of children who enter school

Advanced Subjects Test, university entrance exam that assesses candidates’ higher level knowledge of specific subjects and their readiness to study in their selected academic discipline (Tw)/abbr. to 指考[Zhi3 kao3]
pinyin: Da4 xue2 Ru4 xue2 Zhi3 ding4 Ke1 mu4 Kao3 shi4
containing_words.word: 大學入學指定科目考試

sentences.english: I'm generally pretty impressed by what the, what my classmates  have gotten up to before they came to school here.
sentences.chinese: 我的同學在入學之前已經完成的事情讓我印象深刻。

sentences.english: Scholarships will be canceled for those who cannot pass the health examination.
sentences.chinese: 入學體檢不合格者，獎學金資格將被取消。

sentences.english: He enrolled at a famous University.
sentences.chinese: 他入學一所著名的大學。

sentences.english: So every year an increasing number of college stu dents take the post-graduate entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 因此，每年有越來越多的大學生參加研究生入學考試。

sentences.english: Many major state universities doubled or tripled their enrollments in one or two years.
sentences.chinese: 許多主要州立大學的入學人數在一兩年內翻了兩三倍。

sentences.english: Compared to the pre-MBA survey, the percentage of working in manufacturing industry basically unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 與入學前相比，製造業的比例基本保持不變。

sentences.english: I understand that failure to fully complete this form may result in my application being refused.
sentences.chinese: 我明白若有不實之處，我的入學申請將會被取消。

sentences.english: University teachers do graduate and doctoral entrance exam questions will be, too.
sentences.chinese: 大學老師做研究生和博士生入學考試試題也會如此。

sentences.english: Peggy studies hard in order to pass the entrance exam.
sentences.chinese: 佩吉爲了要通過入學考而用功讀書。

sentences.english: Applicants presenting International Baccalaureate diplomas are eligible for general admission to the University.
sentences.chinese: 申請人提交國際文憑文憑一般大學入學資格。

sentences.english: International students with bachelor degrees are eligible to apply for master programs at NPIC.
sentences.chinese: 外國學生具學士學位者，得申請入學本校碩士班。

sentences.english: That’s why Beijing high school principals concern themselves primarily with student recruitment and admission.
sentences.chinese: 因此，北京中學負責人最關心的事就是招生和入學。

sentences.english: In addition to admissions and denials, the defendant may also make affirmative defenses and counterclaims in the answer.
sentences.chinese: 除了入學和否認，被告也可在答案肯定防禦和反訴。

sentences.english: I am applying for admission to Stanford University.
sentences.chinese: 我正在申請史丹佛大學的入學許可。

sentences.english: He did not even pass the entrance examination to get into Zurich Polytechnic School.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至沒有通過蘇黎世工藝學校的入學考試。

sentences.english: The entrance examinations to high school began yesterday morning.
sentences.chinese: 中學入學考試昨天上午開始了。

definition: to enter oneself for an examination
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)
to enter the next grade school
head of a household/family head/patriarch/parent or guardian of a child
to open/to start (a business etc)/to set up
